Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
03/17/2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12206 Staff qualifications; volunteer, contractors on
central registry
• (3) An agency's policy on staff qualifications
must state all the following:
• (a) A person who has unsupervised
contact with children may not have been
convicted of either of the following:
• (i) Child abuse or neglect.
Six of six employee files reviewed did not have a current Central Registry check.
CPA Rule 400.12212 Personnel records.
(2) The personnel record must contain all the following
information before employment may occur:
(e) A record of any convictions other than minor traffic
violations from either of the following:
(i) The Michigan state police, tribal police, or the
equivalent state or Canadian provincial law
enforcement agency where the person usually resides.
(ii) An entity accessing either Michigan state
police records or equivalent state or Canadian
provincial law enforcement agency where the
person usually resides.

Six of six employee files did not have a criminal background check.
CPA Rule 400.12502 Program statement
• (1) An agency shall have and follow a current
written program statement that includes all the
following information:
• (c) Services provided.
Four of four files reviewed did not document counseling progress notes.
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (3) When case responsibility changes from 1 child
placing agency to another child placing agency, a
modified service plan must be completed within 30
calendar days of the change in agency
responsibility if no other plan is done within 30
days. The plan must address why the agency
responsibility changed and whether there are any
modifications to existing service plan.
One of four files reviewed did not have a current Initial Service Plan.Service Plan.
CPA Rule 400.12504 Eligibility requirements
• (2) All the following must be in the case record
before a youth is placed in independent living:
• (e) An evaluation of a youth's need for
supervision and a plan for providing the
level of supervision determined
necessary.
Four of four files reviewed did not document an evaluation of a youths need for
supervision and a plan for providing the level of supervision determined
necessary.
CPA Rule 400.12504 Eligibility requirements
• (2) All the following must be in the case record
before a youth is placed in independent living:

• (a) How the youth meets the eligibility
requirements for the specific program the
youth is being placed into.
Four of four files reviewed did not document how the youth meets eligibility
requirements for the program.
CPA Rule 400.12504 Eligibility requirements
• (2) All the following must be in the case record
before a youth is placed in independent living:
• (b) The basis for concluding that a youth
exhibits self-care potential.
Four of four files reviewed did not document the basis for concluding that a youth
exhibits self-care potential.
CPA Rule 400.12504 Eligibility requirements
• (2) All the following must be in the case record
before a youth is placed in independent living:
• (d) The availability of specific and
relevant resources that provide for
suitable social, physical, educational,
vocational, and emotional needs of a
youth.
Four of four files reviewed did not document the availability of specific and
relevant resources that provide for suitable social, physical, educational,
vocational and emotional needs of the youth.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• The agency has help desk tickets in to address the problem of the agency
case manager not being identified and attached to the Chief Administrator in
the MISACWIS system. Therefore, service plans cannot be written within the
system. The Chief Administrator was advised until the issue is resolved to use
a template to create service plans.
• Technical assistance was provided regarding the timely completion and
submission of the Chief Administrators Annual Assessment. The assessment
is to be completed annually and be submitted at the annual audit entrance
meeting.

V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was not requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrators assessment was reviewed. The assessment notes that
staffing has presented challenges as well as a loss of revenue during the transition
from a CCI to a CPA license. The agency currently has four youth placed. The CA
is working to obtain grants, sponsorships and donations to assist in financial
security of the agency. The program is newly licensed 6 months ago, so no CAP
was reviewed.
Financial Overview
The agency is a new agency licensed 5 months ago. The budget that was
submitted during the original licensing period was reviewed and uploaded.
Since the agency has been licensed and operational for 5 months, a certified
public accountant financial assessment is not due at this time.
Staff and Youth Interviews
The Chief Administrator was interviewed. She reported that 4 youth were admitted
to the program in February 2025 and early March 2025 and thus far, things are
going well. She noted she is thinking about seeking another case manager.
Two program residents were interviewed. Each youth reported liking the program
and that things were going well. One youth reported working online for his diploma
and is interested in joining the military. This youth reported he plans to get
connected to a military recruiter in Sault Ste Marie. The second youth interviewed
is currently looking for employment.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency ILP home was clean and well maintained. The program is housed in a
modern two story duplex home in rural Sault Ste Marie.

VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The agency is an independent living program and therefore the CPA Analyst does not
provide a review.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
